title: Lionesses : Daisy May Cooper and Maisie Adam star in advert | Wilts and Gloucestershire Standard
body_text:
CIRENCESTER celebrity Daisy May Cooper had a hilarious moment in a new uplifting advert for the Lionesses ahead of next month's European Championships.
Cooper, who is well-known for her Swindon Town and England tops in BBC comedy This Country, appeared in a two minute video about the Lionesses before this afternoon's squad announcement for the Euros which will be held in Switzerland.
Sports personality of the year Keely Hodgkinson, former player turned pundit Karen Carney and radio host Vick Hope also take part in the uplifting video which features flashbacks to memorable moments in English women's football.
Male football stars Ian Wright and Jude Bellingham also wish the best of luck to the Lionesses in the two minute clip.
In it fellow comedian Maisie Adam - who also hosts a women's football podcast - asks the star who grew up in Cirencester if she was 'still on for Switzerland' to which she answers 'yes, defo'.
Maisie then says 'she definitely won't make it' while Cooper asks some cows in the fields where the Euros will be located.
When sharing the video on social media platform Instagram, Mrs Cooper said: "Come on England.
"You've got this girls."
Cooper then ends the video by shouting 'Come on England' while kicking the ball away with her shoe coming off at the same time.
England are the holders of the Euros, having sensationally beaten Germany at Wembley four years ago.
One of the favourites for the title, the squad for the Lionesses will be revealed this afternoon by coach Sarina Wiegman.
Daisy May Cooper was recently interviewed by Little Britain stars David Walliams and Matt Lucas on their podcast while she also featured in the Amazon Prime show Last Out Laughing.
The second series of her acclaimed BBC TV show Am I Being Unreasonable? was also released recently.
